firstSessionFailures: Tutors with lower profile completion rates tend to have a significantly lower first session success rate (66.9% vs. 82.1%).
High-risk tutors have a much lower average rating and first session success compared to low-risk tutors (1.95 vs. 4.14 and 16.6% vs. 92.4%).
A large percentage of first sessions are unsuccessful due to tutor-initiated rescheduling, contributing to poor experiences.
commonRiskFactors: High reschedule rates among tutors correlate strongly with poor student experiences (12.8% for high-risk tutors).
At-risk tutors often have lower profile completion rates, which may affect student trust and engagement.
A small subset of tutors generates multiple support tickets, indicating potential reliability issues.

systemRecommendations: Implement stricter profile completion requirements to ensure tutors present themselves effectively, aiming for a minimum of 80% completion.
Develop a monitoring and support system for tutors with high reschedule rates, providing additional training or intervention as needed.
